question: Foreign body from trachea most common goes to right bronchus due to -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i.e., Wider & in continuous line with trachea o Trachea bifurcates at Carina (at Lower border of T4 vertebra at T4-T5 disc space) into right and left principal (primary) bronchi.o Right principal bronchus is wider, shorter (2-5 cm long), and more vertical in the line of trachea (25deg with median plane).o Therefore a foreign body is most likely to lodge in the right bronchus.
opb: Wider & in continuous line with trachea

question: Cartilage in trachea -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., Hyalineo Tracheal rings are hyaline cartilage.Types of Cartilages Hyaline CartilageElastic CartilageFibrocartilage Articular cartilageArytenoid cartilageThyroid cartilageCricoid cartilageEpiphyseal growth plateNasal septumCostal cartilage of ribsTracheal rings ExampleAuricleAuditory tubeEpiglottisCuneiform cartilage of larynxExternal auditoiy canalArticular discsIntervertebral discsMenisciPublic symphysisAcetabular labrum
